formElement.label: Configuration name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Physical location of the jboss client script:
formElement.documentation: Provide the physical location of the jboss Command Line Interface script, i.e: 'jboss-cli.bat', '/path/to/jboss-cli.sh'. If omitted, script location from configuration will be used.

formElement.label: Connection driver URL:
formElement.documentation: The JDBC driver connection URL. i.e., 'jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/ectest'.

formElement.label: Driver class:
formElement.documentation: The fully qualifed name of the JDBC driver class. i.e., 'com.mysql.jdbc.Driver'.

formElement.label: JNDI name:
formElement.documentation: Specifies the JNDI name for the datasource. This should start with either java:/ or java:jboss/. i.e., 'java:jboss/datasources/MySql'.

formElement.label: Driver name:
formElement.documentation: Defines the JDBC driver the datasource should use. This can be either the name of the .jar file or the name of the module, depending on how the driver has been deployed. i.e., 'mysql-connector-java-5.1.20-bin.jar'.

formElement.label: Datasource credential:
formElement.documentation: Specify credential that contains username and password for data source.

formElement.label: Enable Datasource?:
formElement.documentation: Specifies if the datasource should be enabled after creation.
